items.title: Moscow’s Military Capabilities Are in Question After Failed Battle for Ukrainian City
items.abstract: A disastrous Russian assault on Vuhledar, viewed as an opening move in an expected spring offensive, has renewed doubts about Moscow’s ability to sustain a large-scale ground assault.

items.title: Powerful Cyclone Lashes Mumbai as City Grapples With Coronavirus
items.abstract: The Indian city of 20 million had not been threatened by a storm as strong as Cyclone Nisarga in 70 years.

items.title: Taliban Claim They’ve Taken Control of Western Afghan City, Farah
items.abstract: Government officials and their American military backers vowed that they would quickly oust the insurgents from the city.

items.title: Equipped to Weather Big Storms, a Jersey City Tower Draws Tenants
items.abstract: Although Jersey City’s office market has been struggling, a building that already offers backup generators and a fiber optic network has been attracting new tenants.

items.title: A Small Step for Space Force Is Not a Giant Leap for Uniform Design
items.abstract: The unveiling of the new military branch’s name tape — “U.S. Space Force,” embroidered in blue — was overshadowed by reactions to its familiar camouflage uniform.
keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces
